title: Musk subpoenaed in government’s Jeffrey Epstein lawsuit against JPMorgan
description: Prosecutors asked a judge for permission to serve Telsa with the subpoena instead of Musk because they have been unable to locate the billionaire.

title: CEO behind ChatGPT warns Congress AI could cause 'harm to the world’
description: In his first Congressional testimony, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman called for extensive regulation, including a new government agency charged with licensing AI models.

title: The internet’s memory is fading in front of us. Preserve what you can.
description: A generation of people were told that what goes on the internet, stays on the internet. But the web's memory is more malleable than that.

title: U.S. charges Russian man in Babuk ransomware attack on D.C. police
description: The Justice, Treasury and State departments announced a crackdown on global ransomware suspect Mikhail Matveev, setting a $10 million reward for his arrest and announcing economic sanctions.

title: Jailed Saudi dissident, sister sue Twitter under RICO act in spy case
description: The suit argues Twitter broke the law by letting employees reveal the identity of dissidents to Saudi agents who then arrested them.

title: AI congressional hearing live updates: OpenAI CEO testifies to Senate
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman will testify to Congress on AI like ChatGPT as regulations and oversight are being considered.

title: Apple will let you teach your iPhone to speak in your voice
description: Apple has developed accessibility features, including one that allows people at risk of permanent voice loss, to preserve — and keep using — their voices.

title: Who is Sam Altman, the OpenAI CEO testifying at Congress?
description: Long-time Silicon Valley investor Sam Altman helped start OpenAI as a research project in 2015. Now, it's one of the most powerful AI companies in tech.

title: Telecom giant Vodafone to cut 10 percent of global workforce
description: Global cellphone provider Vodafone said it would cut 11,000 jobs after new CEO Margherita Della Valle said financial results had "not been good enough."
